summary: Experienced General Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the oil and energy industry. Strong sales professional skilled in Negotiation, Operations Management, Analytical Skills, Facility Management (FM), and Team Building.

profile_positions.description: Responsible for all logistics including meeting with tank personnel and coordinating pre-job requirements. Performs a full range of supervisory responsibilities including training, scheduling of work, grievances, performance counseling, and recommendations for promotions, demotions and termination of employment. Ensures that all relevant Human Resources and HSE policies and procedures are followed and adhered to.  Apply knowledge of industry to analyze and manage day to day operations to ensure efficient and effective services for the customer. Ensure crew members are meeting customer and company requirements. Reviews the job parameters and specifics with appropriate personnel in the preplanning stages of the job. Verifies all dispatch information, load information, fluid, chemical, equipment are ready for service. Instructs crew members in job procedures, route to location, convoy procedures, rig-up assignments, job assignments, monitoring safety equipment, monitoring communication equipment, and reviewing any special conditions. Confirms DOT regulations are observed by all drivers. Directs and supervises the designated representative to begin the equipment spotting procedure. Conducts a safety meeting with crew prior to start up, daily, and during job, if job changes occur after start up. Reviews the finished project with crew when service is complete, and oversees cleanup to prepare for return to home base. Prepares reports and schedules to ensure accuracy and efficiency. Inspects work performed to ensure that it meets specifications and established standards. Instructs work crew in work policies and procedures, and the use and maintenance of equipment. Investigates complaints about service and equipment, and takes corrective action. Oversees equipment maintenance to ensure that it is in working order. Confirms all equipment is operational. Identifies and recognizes changes in circumstances, with attentiveness to security violations or an emergency situation.
profile_positions.title: Service Supervisor 1

profile_positions.description: Responsible for leading, managing and developing the Operations Teams, Operations Management, Inventory Accounting, Facilities Management, Budget Planning and Management. ♦ Command and Control of all Fuel and Security related activities within camp, maintain positive relationship with contract holder. ♦ Monitor all contractors to ensure contractual requirements are met, military standards for fuel quality and safety adhered to ♦ Responsible for observing, assessing and inspecting processes and operations ♦ Ensure all operations are compliant to company SOPs, QHSE directives
profile_positions.title: General Manager - Hairatan BXP

profile_positions.description: In charge of daily 24x7 operation of a fuel distribution center, handling storage and transport of 3 fuels types (F35, F34 and F54), storing ~1.5M liters (396K gallons) of each fuel type for use by U.S. and NATO forces at Forward Operating Bases. Facility distributes 1.2M liters weekly of 2 fuel types via 200 daily trucks. Plan training schedules for staff development; direct a staff of 40 with 5 direct reports. Daily liaise with General Manager to ensure distribution requirements are met, and with security forces to ensure adherence to security procedures.
profile_positions.title: Western Regional Distribution Center (WRDC) Operations Manager

profile_positions.description: ♦ Coordinated all communications with U.S. and NATO fuel representatives to facilitate fuel deliveries and future fuel demand to maintain required stock levels. ♦ Instrumental in acquiring new business contracts to deliver oil, lubricants, helium, and nitrogen used in U.S. and NATO equipment beginning March 2010.  ♦ Recovered $3.3M in missing fuel receipts enabling company to recoup more than $5.6M in reimbursements.
profile_positions.title: Liaison Officer

profile_positions.description: ♦ Ensured operations of facility warehouse were in compliance with company policies, procedures, and government requirements regarding product handling and safety.  ♦ Reviewed daily work volume and balanced staffing levels to maximize production.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Full Case, San Marcos Wharehouse

profile_positions.description: ♦ Charged with directing daily operations and functions of 20+ employees in production to meet or exceed production targets. Rewarded for highest safety levels in the plant ♦ Reduced process time by 20% with personal design and install of major end item parts, re-machining, and weld plan for production tooling that also eliminated near miss reports.
profile_positions.title: Operations Leader

profile_positions.description:
Advanced through positions of increased accountability for operations by exceeding goals and expectations. CAPTAIN, FT. HOOD, TX (FEB. 2008- APR. 2008) ♦ Researched, created, and launched annual pre-deployment training cycle and ensured appropriate training was followed by all subordinate companies. Created a Battalion-wide training cycle for post-deployment still in use today. 1st Lieutenant, Quartermaster, Executive Officer, Taji, Iraq (Mar. 2006 – Feb. 2008) ♦ Deployed & led as 2nd in command of 200+ personnel and property valued in excess of $60M. ♦ Improved equipment operational readiness from 88% to 98%. 
 1st Lieutenant, Quartermaster, Asst. Battalion Operations Officer, Fort Hood, TX (Sep. 2005- Mar. 2006) ♦ Commended for developing tactics, techniques and operating procedures for the Brigade Troops  ♦ Orchestrated ambitious gunnery schedule and unit-training schedule resulting in 200% qualification rate. 
 2nd Lieutenant, Quartermaster, POL (Fuel) Platoon Leader, Fort Hood, TX (Mar. 2004- Sep. 2005) ♦ Deployed 2004 and received Army Commendation Medal for movement of personnel, material and distribution of 2.2M gallons of fuel in and around Baghdad. Completed 70+ convoys as commander without any fatalities or serious incidents.
profile_positions.title: Quartermaster Officer
